contentrichtext.text: {{Notability|Companies|date=January 2011}} {{Refimprove|date=January 2011}} [[Image:Virus recordings logo.png|thumb|right|100px|Virus logo.]] '''Virus Recordings''' is an influential [[United Kingdom|UK]]-based [[drum and bass]] [[record label]], specialising in the [[techstep]] and [[neurofunk]] sub-genres.<ref>IMO Records [http://www.imorecords.co.uk/drumandbasslabels/virus-recordings-biography/ "Virus Recordings"], ''[[IMO Records]]'', Retrieved on 12 December 2011.</ref> Founded by [[Ed Rush]] and [[Optical (artist)|Optical]] in [[1998 in music|1998]], the label is known as the main home of the duo as well as [[Fierce (artist)|Fierce]], [[Matrix (artist)|Matrix]], and MC [[Ryme Tyme]]. With a series of releases from all these artists and others like [[Bad Company (drum and bass group)|Bad Company]] and [[Cause 4 Concern]], including the owners' seminal debut LP, ''[[Wormhole (album)|Wormhole]]''. The label was intimately associated with the rise of the dark, [[sci-fi]] and [[techno music|techno]] influenced [[techstep]] and [[neurofunk]] sounds in the late 1990s. ==List of Virus Albums== 001 LP: Wormhole - Ed Rush & Optical 002 LP: Sleepwalk - Matrix 003 LP: The Creeps - Ed Rush & Optical 004 LP: The Original Doctor Shade - Ed Rush & Optical 005 LP: Virus Vaults - Ed Rush & Optical 006 LP: Chameleon - Optical & Ed Rush 007 LP: Travel The Galaxy - Ed Rush & Optical 008 LP: Genesis Device - Audio 009 LP: Dirty Tricks - Optiv & BTK 010 LP: Soulmagnet - Audio ==See also== * [[List of record labels]] * [[List of electronic music record labels]] * [[List of jungle and drum n bass record labels]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * {{discogs label}} * [http://www.rolldabeats.com/label/virus_recordings Virus Recordings] listing at [[Rolldabeats]]. {{Use dmy dates|date=January 2012}} [[Category:British record labels]] [[Category:Drum and bass record labels]] [[Category:Record labels established in 1998]]
